019
020package com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.sizes;
021
022import java.io.File;
023
024import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.StatelessCheck;
025import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AbstractFileSetCheck;
026import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.FileText;
027
028/**
029 * <div>
030 * Checks for long source files.
031 * </div>
032 *
033 * <p>
034 * Rationale: If a source file becomes very long it is hard to understand.
035 * Therefore, long classes should usually be refactored into several
036 * individual classes that focus on a specific task.
037 * </p>
038 *
039 * @since 3.2
040 */
041@StatelessCheck
042public class FileLengthCheck extends AbstractFileSetCheck {
043
044    /**
045     * A key is pointing to the warning message text in "messages.properties"
046     * file.
047     */
048    public static final String MSG_KEY = "maxLen.file";
049
050    /** Default maximum number of lines. */
051    private static final int DEFAULT_MAX_LINES = 2000;
052
053    /** Specify the maximum number of lines allowed. */
054    private int max = DEFAULT_MAX_LINES;
055
056    @Override
057    protected void processFiltered(File file, FileText fileText) {
058        if (fileText.size() > max) {
059            log(1, MSG_KEY, fileText.size(), max);
060        }
061    }
062
063    /**
064     * Setter to specify the maximum number of lines allowed.
065     *
066     * @param length the maximum length of a Java source file
067     * @since 3.2
068     */
069    public void setMax(int length) {
070        max = length;
071    }
072
073}
